cholera.description: Cholera is an infectious disease that causes severe watery diarrhea, which can lead to dehydration and even death if not treated promptly.
cholera.prevention: Cholera can be prevented by practicing good hygiene and avoiding contaminated food and water sources.
cholera.treatment: Treatment involves rehydration with oral rehydration solution (ORS) or intravenous fluids and antibiotics in severe cases.

malaria.description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease caused by a parasite. It leads to recurrent fever, chills, and other flu-like symptoms.
malaria.prevention: Preventing malaria involves using insect repellents, bed nets, and taking antimalarial medications when traveling to endemic areas.
malaria.treatment: Malaria is treated with antimalarial drugs, and the choice of drug depends on the type of malaria and its severity.

influenza.description: Influenza, or the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses. It can cause mild to severe symptoms.
influenza.prevention: Flu can be prevented by getting an annual flu vaccine and practicing good respiratory hygiene.
influenza.treatment: Treatment may involve antiviral medications, rest, and staying hydrated.

pneumonia.description: Pneumonia is an inflammatory condition of the lung affecting the air sacs. It can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms.
pneumonia.prevention: Preventing pneumonia includes vaccination against certain bacteria and viruses, good hygiene, and not smoking.
pneumonia.treatment: Treatment depends on the cause and may involve antibiotics, antiviral drugs, or supportive care.

diabetes.description: Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body processes glucose, leading to high blood sugar levels.
diabetes.prevention: Preventing diabetes involves maintaining a healthy diet, regular physical activity, and managing weight.
diabetes.treatment: Treatment may include medication, insulin therapy, and lifestyle changes.
